item.title: Hello :)
item.description:
My name is Yujin Zhang (pronounced You-jean Jaang). I'm a backend software engineer in San Francisco. I graduated from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (M.S.), University of Michigan Ann Arbor (B.S.), and Shanghai Jiao Tong University (B.S.). I enjoy going to parks, biking to work, organizing spaces, reading fictions, and playing Nintendo Ring Fit Adventure.

Â 

For projects below, click thumbnails or “Go to website” to jump to github repos. Click titles to read more.

item.title: Tower of Babylon
item.description: A 3D platform game where the hero climbs a four-sided tower while dogding and attacking enemies. His weapon can switch between a hammer and a propeller, helping him attack as well as jump and climb. The weapon is controlled purely by joysticks, creating a gameplay experience without button pressing.

item.title: STARTS Offline Mode
item.description: STARTS (STAtic Regression Test Selection) is a Maven plugin that helps you run only the impacted tests since last build. I worked on speeding up the dependency analysis phase (by 70%) by making it concurrent with the test execution phase.

item.title: Artistic Face Stylizer
item.description: A face stylizer that puts an artistic mask generated from a portrait painting on the face in a photo. It detects facial keypoints, warps the painting onto the photo according to the keypoints, and blends them with different weights on different areas.

item.title: Rope Chat
item.description: A chat website with threaded messaging UI designed by myself. This is a project for me to learn React. Paused as I do not plan to go deeper into the frontend world for now.

item.title: Skin Care Recommander
item.description: A search engine backend for recommanding skin care products on Amazon according to effects (e.g. anti-aging) and product types. Boost products with high-star reviews mentioning the effects in the query.

item.title: Publication
item.description: S.W. Lee, Y. Zhang, I. Wong, Y. Yang, S.D. O'Keefe, W.S. Lasecki. SketchExpress: Remixing Animations for More Effective Crowd-Powered Prototyping of Interactive Interfaces
